/-- The Fourier integral of an `L^1` function is a continuous function. -/
theorem fourier_integral_continuous [TopologicalSpace.FirstCountableTopology W] (he : Continuous e)
    (hL : Continuous fun p : V Ã— W => L p.1 p.2) {f : V â†’ E} (hf : integrable f Î¼) :
    Continuous (fourier_integral e Î¼ L f) := by

  Â· exact hf.norm

    refine' ae_of_all _ fun v => (he.comp (continuous_of_add.comp _)).smul continuous_const
    refine' (hL.comp (continuous_prod_mk.mpr âŸ¨continuous_const, continuous_idâŸ©)).neg

theorem fourier_integral_add (he : Continuous e) (hL : Continuous fun p : V Ã— W => L p.1 p.2) {f g : V â†’ E}
